=== Game Rules ===
Game rules in natural language:
This game is essentially an arcade-style space shooter, where you control a spaceship (the avatar) in a space setting. Here’s a breakdown:

• Game Genre:
 – A classic arcade space shooter, similar in spirit to games like Space Invaders or Galaga.

• Game Mechanics:
 – You pilot an avatar (a spaceship with a “FlakAvatar” behavior) that can fire projectiles (named “sam”) upward.
 – Your missiles and sam projectiles interact with various objects—for example, hitting an alien with your projectile not only destroys the alien but also earns you points.
 – Enemies come in the form of aliens that spawn from invisible “portal” spawn points. These aliens exhibit bomber behavior: they move and occasionally drop bombs aimed downward.
 – The bombs move slowly but pose a threat: if a bomb collides with the base (a stationary “planet” object) or with your avatar, it may result in losing points or other adverse effects.
 – There are specific collision interactions defined. For instance:
  – When an alien is hit by your projectile (sam), it’s destroyed and you get extra points.
  – If your ship collides with an alien or a bomb, it destroys the alien/bomb but decreases your score.
  – The base interacts with projectiles too (for example, if a sam projectile hits the base, both are killed, but you gain a point). This likely represents the dynamics between your friendly base and enemy fire—it might be critical to protect this base.
 – Some enemies change direction upon reaching the edge of the screen (“EOS”), forcing them to patrol or change course.

• Game Objective and Win/Loss Conditions:
 – Your overall goal is to eliminate the extraterrestrial threat. Specifically, the game ends in victory when all portals and alien sprites have been eradicated (no more enemy spawns and aliens on screen).
 – On the other hand, you lose if your avatar is destroyed (the sprite counter for your avatar drops to zero).

• Overall Strategy:
 – Stay agile: Constantly maneuver your spaceship to avoid enemy bombs and the collision of aliens.
 – Prioritize threats: Aim your fire carefully to take out aliens before they can drop bombs. Clearing enemy clusters quickly will help prevent overwhelming challenges from multiple sources.
 – Manage the portals: Since aliens continuously spawn from them, focusing your attacks to eventually eliminate both portal types (slow and fast) is key to stopping the enemy influx.
 – Protect the base: Given that both bombs and misdirected projectiles can harm your base, you want to keep an eye on both your avatar and the base to avoid collateral damage.
 – Balance risk and reward: While some collisions might destroy enemies and give points, they may also cost you points or leave you vulnerable. Precision and careful positioning are crucial.

In plain terms, you’re in a high-stakes space battle backdropped by a vivid cosmic setting. Your mission is to skillfully pilot your ship, target and destroy alien forces and their spawn points, all while dodging bombs and preserving your home base. By keeping a cool head and managing both offense and defense carefully, you can clear the screen and secure victory.

You are an intelligent player playing a video game, and you have a friend provide you strategy. Interpret the state, rule, strategy and act accordingly. Notice that your avatar position is one of the most important information, if the position doesn't change from the last state, you need to analyze the state and make a different action from the last time.

=== Available Actions ===
0: ACTION_NIL
1: ACTION_USE
2: ACTION_LEFT
3: ACTION_RIGHT

=== Important Mechanics Notice ===
 In some games, directional actions (LEFT, RIGHT, UP, DOWN) may first cause the avatar to rotate toward the intended direction without immediately moving. If the avatar's position does not change after a directional action, it may indicate a rotation has occurred. To proceed, you must apply the directional action again after rotation. Always verify whether the avatar actually moved after each action. Please understand the rule and the interaction set first, then locate the item, finally choose a meaningful action towards the win and respond in the format: ``` Action:<action number> ```. Include one sentence of feedback on the action and your expectation to see if it aligns with the strategy. Notice, Action 0 will not reasult in any change in this game environment, and you may need to understand the level layout first to play the game.
